{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3480458,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-12T23:34:36.588Z","cooked":"

While investigating the baseline CPU utilization jump we at the YAGSL team (mostly @jwt388 who is an amazing mentor for Team 151!) we found that there may be correlation between the new REVLib 2025. We are going to confirm this tomorrow on a MAXSwerve robot with a NavX gyro.

Has anyone else seen a very large spike in CPU utilization in REVLib 2025?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-01-12T23:34:36.588Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":255,"readers_count":254,"score":151.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":481295,"topic_slug":"revlib-2025-cpu-utilization-increases","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51887,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"YAGSL & YASS Creator "},"post_url":"/t/revlib-2025-cpu-utilization-increases/481295/1","custom_user_title":"YAGSL & YASS Creator ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3481050,"name":"","username":"jwt388","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwt388/{size}/233228_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-13T17:19:08.826Z","cooked":"

I saw high CPU (~60%) running a test program with all latest sw/fw for just a single SparkMax/Neo or a single SparkFlex/Vortex. No other 3rd party dependencies. I also have our 2024 bot updated to 2025 code with 10 SparkMax running at 22%. I will try to get more data today. If anyone else is seeing high CPU with 2025 it may help pinpoint the problem.

That definitely seems excessive… @jan @Greg_Needel, any ideas? Did you see any increase in CPU utilization while testing newer versions of RevLib?

We have confirmed that this is an issue in REVLib v25.0.0 and have identified the root cause thanks to @Thad_House. A fix will be released very soon. Thank you for the reports.
